name: A Comprehensive Approach to Good Health and Wellness in Indian County – financed solely by Prevention and Public Health
objective: The program supports initiatives and public health capacity to prevent heart disease, diabetes and associated risk factors in American Indian and Alaska Native (AI/AN) communities through a holistic approach to population health and wellness.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services
sub_agency_name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
applicant_types: Native American Organizations (includes Indian groups, cooperatives, corporations, partnerships, associations)

authorizations.text: Public Health Service Act, as amended, Section 301(a) and Section 317K, 42 U.S.C. 241(a); 42 U.S.C. 247b-12.

rules_regulations: Regulations governing this program are published under 45 CFR Part 75.
